abstract: Somalia and American officials say that Ahmed Abdi Godane, leader of Shabab, Somali militant group that has allied itself with Al Qaeda, may have been killed in American airstrikes; Godane has been one of the most wanted figures in Africa, widely believed to have orchestrated countless attacks on civilians, including 2013 massacre of dozens of shoppers at mall in Nariobi.

snippet: The intertwined journeys of two friends toward militancy offer a sharp example of how the allure of Islamist extremism has evolved, enticing similar pools of young Americans to conflicts in different parts of the world.
lead_paragraph: The intertwined journeys of two friends toward militancy offer a sharp example of how the allure of Islamist extremism has evolved, enticing similar pools of young Americans to conflicts in different parts of the world.
abstract: Intertwined journeys of Troy Kastigar and Douglas McAuthur McCain, Minnesota men who died after joining Islamic militants, offer sharp example of how allure of Islamist extremism has evolved; tools of online propaganda and shadowy networks of facilitators are now drawing hundreds of Europeans and about dozen known Americans to fight with Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

snippet: Islamist rebels blew up a car bomb and gunmen attacked a national intelligence site in Somalia's capital where suspected militants are held, in an assault on Sunday that left at least 12 people dead.
lead_paragraph: Islamist rebels blew up a car bomb and gunmen attacked a national intelligence site in Somalia's capital where suspected militants are held, in an assault on Sunday that left at least 12 people dead.

headline.main: Islamist Rebels Attack Intelligence Site in Somalia, 12 Killed
headline.print_headline: Islamist Rebels Attack Intelligence Site in Somalia, 12 Killed

snippet: The United States is still assessing whether al Shabaab leader Ahmed Abdi Godane was killed along with other al Qaeda-linked militants in a U.S. airstrike in Somalia on Monday, a U.S. official told Reuters on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The United States is still assessing whether al Shabaab leader Ahmed Abdi Godane was killed along with other al Qaeda-linked militants in a U.S. airstrike in Somalia on Monday, a U.S. official told Reuters on Tuesday.

headline.main: Unclear if Somalia Militant Leader Killed in Strike-U.S. Official
headline.print_headline: Unclear if Somalia Militant Leader Killed in Strike-U.S. Official

snippet: Inside the small office, the line of sweating clients waiting to renew their satellite TV subscriptions keeps growing. Technicians crimp wires and test signal strength of boxes while others go to homes across the Somali capital to install new systems...
lead_paragraph: Inside the small office, the line of sweating clients waiting to renew their satellite TV subscriptions keeps growing. Technicians crimp wires and test signal strength of boxes while others go to homes across the Somali capital to install new systems or fix faulty ones.

headline.main: Somalia TV Sales Grow as Many Avoid Public Places
headline.print_headline: Somalia TV Sales Grow as Many Avoid Public Places

snippet: Three men were executed by firing squad on Sunday after a Somali military court found them guilty of killing civilians in a series of recent attacks in the country blamed on al Shabaab Islamist militants.
lead_paragraph: Three men were executed by firing squad on Sunday after a Somali military court found them guilty of killing civilians in a series of recent attacks in the country blamed on al Shabaab Islamist militants.

headline.main: Somalia Executes Three Suspected Militants by Firing Squad
headline.print_headline: Somalia Executes Three Suspected Militants by Firing Squad

snippet: A Somali police officer says a bomb hidden in piles of garbage detonated in the Somali capital, killing three street cleaners.
lead_paragraph: A Somali police officer says a bomb hidden in piles of garbage detonated in the Somali capital, killing three street cleaners.

headline.main: Somalia: Bomb Hidden in Garbage Kills 3
headline.print_headline: Somalia: Bomb Hidden in Garbage Kills 3

snippet: Somalia has posted an ambassador to the United States for the first time in more than 20 years.
lead_paragraph: Somalia has posted an ambassador to the United States for the first time in more than 20 years.

headline.main: Somalia Ambassador Arrives in US
headline.print_headline: Somalia Ambassador Arrives in US

snippet: War-ravaged Somalia is hurtling towards a second famine in three years that could be prevented if donors increased funding, Philippe Lazzarini, United Nations' humanitarian coordinator for Somalia said on Sunday.
lead_paragraph: War-ravaged Somalia is hurtling towards a second famine in three years that could be prevented if donors increased funding, Philippe Lazzarini, United Nations' humanitarian coordinator for Somalia said on Sunday.

headline.main: Somalia Donors Must Act Now to Avoid Famine 'Catastrophe' - U.N
headline.print_headline: Somalia Donors Must Act Now to Avoid Famine 'Catastrophe' - U.N

snippet: Sierra Leone, which is battling to contain the deadly Ebola virus, will stop new rotations of its U.N.-led forces into Somalia for now as authorities move to establish safeguards, Somalia's president said on Monday.
lead_paragraph: Sierra Leone, which is battling to contain the deadly Ebola virus, will stop new rotations of its U.N.-led forces into Somalia for now as authorities move to establish safeguards, Somalia's president said on Monday.

headline.main: Ebola Fears Halt Rotations of Sierra Leone Forces Into Somalia
headline.print_headline: Ebola Fears Halt Rotations of Sierra Leone Forces Into Somalia

snippet: A military spokesman for the African Union mission in Somalia says the AU has canceled a planned troop rotation by Sierra Leonean forces because of the Ebola outbreak.
lead_paragraph: A military spokesman for the African Union mission in Somalia says the AU has canceled a planned troop rotation by Sierra Leonean forces because of the Ebola outbreak.

headline.main: Ebola Fears Nix Sierra Leone Troop Trip to Somalia
headline.print_headline: Ebola Fears Nix Sierra Leone Troop Trip to Somalia

snippet: More than 200 suspects were arrested Tuesday in a security sweep aimed at stemming a wave of militant attacks in the Somali capital of Mogadishu, said a senior police official.
lead_paragraph: More than 200 suspects were arrested Tuesday in a security sweep aimed at stemming a wave of militant attacks in the Somali capital of Mogadishu, said a senior police official.

headline.main: Hundreds Arrested in Somalia Security Sweep
headline.print_headline: Hundreds Arrested in Somalia Security Sweep

snippet: Investigators want to know if stolen fuel is being sold for profit or is being used to finance political activities, possibly even terrorism.
lead_paragraph: Investigators want to know if stolen fuel is being sold for profit or is being used to finance political activities, possibly even terrorism.
abstract: Interpol, intelligence agencies and military forces in South China Sea are investigating whether fuel stolen from tankers is being sold for profit by criminals or being used to finance political activities, possibly even terrorism; from $1 million to $2 million worth of fuel has been stolen from each of six tankers that have lost part or all of their cargos in the South China Sea since mid-April.

headline.main: Recent Tanker Hijackings Add to Problems in the South China Sea
headline.print_headline: Recent Tanker Hijackings Add to Problems in the South China Sea

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

snippet: News about East African Famine 2011 (Somalia), including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: News about East African Famine 2011 (Somalia), including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.

headline.main: Famine

snippet: President Uhuru Kenyatta said the killing of at least 57 people in two raids was the work of local “political networks,” not Islamic militants.
lead_paragraph: President Uhuru Kenyatta said the killing of at least 57 people in two raids was the work of local “political networks,” not Islamic militants.
abstract: Kenya's Pres Uhuru Kenyatta blames domestic foes, not Somali extremist group Shabab, for attack in Lamu that left at least 57 people dead; Shabab claimed responsibility for attack, but Kenyatta says evidence points to local political networks; some analysts question Kenyatta's effort to shift blame as political ploy.

headline.main: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris.
byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and DAN BILEFSKY

snippet: The authorities said the attack on a police station and two hotels in the coastal town of Mpeketoni was carried out by the Somali militant group Shabab.
lead_paragraph: The authorities said the attack on a police station and two hotels in the coastal town of Mpeketoni was carried out by the Somali militant group Shabab.
abstract: At least 48 people are killed in attack by dozens of militants on Kenyan coastal town of Mpeketoni; government blames Somali extremist group the Shabab.

headline.main: Coast Town Is Attacked in Kenya; Dozens Die
headline.print_headline: Coast Town Is Attacked in Kenya; Dozens Die

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris. Jeffrey Gettleman contributed reporting from Antalya, Turkey.
byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and DAN BILEFSKY

snippet: Eleven people have been confirmed dead and 20 others wounded after a car bomb exploded on Monday at a cafe frequented by government officials in the town of Baidoa, officials said.
lead_paragraph: Eleven people have been confirmed dead and 20 others wounded after a car bomb exploded on Monday at a cafe frequented by government officials in the town of Baidoa, officials said.
abstract: Eleven people are confirmed dead and 20 others wounded after car bomb explodes at cafe frequented by government officials in Baidoa, Somalia.

headline.main: Somalia: Attack on Former Official Fails
headline.print_headline: Somalia: Attack on Former Official Fails

snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama says counter-terrorism cooperation with Ethiopia is making a difference in combating extremism in Somalia. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).
lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama says counter-terrorism cooperation with Ethiopia is making a difference in combating extremism in Somalia. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.main: Obama says cooperation with Ethiopia on counter-terrorism is making a difference
headline.sub: Obama says cooperation with Ethiopia on counter-terrorism is making a difference

snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama says counter-terrorism cooperation with Ethiopia is making a difference in combating extremism in Somalia. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).
lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama says counter-terrorism cooperation with Ethiopia is making a difference in combating extremism in Somalia. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

headline.sub: Obama says cooperation with Ethiopia on counter-terrorism is making a difference

snippet: The United Nations food agency warns that Somalia's food crisis could worsen in coming months because of poor rains, shrinking humanitarian assistance and rising cereal prices.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations food agency warns that Somalia's food crisis could worsen in coming months because of poor rains, shrinking humanitarian assistance and rising cereal prices.

headline.main: Drought Looms in Somalia After Poor, Erratic Rains
headline.print_headline: Drought Looms in Somalia After Poor, Erratic Rains

snippet: Female genital cutting has been banned in the United States since 1996, and now it is also illegal to transport girls for “vacation cutting.” But some are concerned that such cutting is on the rise.
lead_paragraph: Female genital cutting has been banned in the United States since 1996, and now it is also illegal to transport girls for “vacation cutting.” But some are concerned that such cutting is on the rise.
abstract: Rising number of immigrant parents from Africa and other nations are sending their daughters back to ancestral homes on summer vacations, where they are then subjected to genital cutting, procedure banned in the United States since 1996; Gambian immigrant Jaha Dukureh, who says she has been cut twice, is at center of support network of girls and women who want to bring issue to attention of the American public and its law enforcement organizations.

headline.main: A Fight as U.S. Girls Face Genital Cutting Abroad
headline.print_headline: A Fight as U.S. Girls Face Genital Cutting Abroad

snippet: Four people were killed when a car laden with explosives blew up near the parliamentary building in the Somali capital, Mogadishu, a police official said Saturday.
lead_paragraph: Four people were killed when a car laden with explosives blew up near the parliamentary building in the Somali capital, Mogadishu, a police official said Saturday.

headline.main: 4 Killed in Car Bomb Attack in Somalia
headline.print_headline: 4 Killed in Car Bomb Attack in Somalia

snippet: China said Monday it will re-open its embassy in Somalia 23 years after evacuating its diplomats as the East African nation plunged into civil war.
lead_paragraph: China said Monday it will re-open its embassy in Somalia 23 years after evacuating its diplomats as the East African nation plunged into civil war.

headline.main: China to Re-Open Embassy in Somalia Closed in 1991
headline.print_headline: China to Re-Open Embassy in Somalia Closed in 1991

snippet: Kenyan fighter jets have attacked two bases belonging to the Shabab insurgent group in Somalia and killed at least 80 militants.
lead_paragraph: Kenyan fighter jets have attacked two bases belonging to the Shabab insurgent group in Somalia and killed at least 80 militants.

headline.main: Somalia: Kenyan Jets Bomb Militants
headline.print_headline: Somalia: Kenyan Jets Bomb Militants
